result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempting to Flee a Traffic Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving one year Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid presription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims Christopher A. and Ashley W.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Restitution set at zero.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.  
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

charges.descr: Attempting to Flee a Traffic Officer

supervisions.notes:
No DNA surcahrge on this count as it has been ordered on count one.
Pay all other costs and surcharges.  From up to 25% of prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

per order dated August 8, 2016, Appeal 2016XX380CR, the deadline for Jones to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through October 7, 2016.
per order dated June 9, 2016, Appeal 2016XX380CR, the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to August 8, 2016.
State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel.

per order dated March 10, 2016 IT IS ORDERED that the State Public Defender shall appoint new counsel for Jones within thirty days of the date of this order. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that successor counsel shall provide this court with a copy of his or her appointment order within five days of the date of appointment.
 IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that successor counsel shall file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal within sixty days of the date of the appointment. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the public defender shall provide successor counsel with a copy of this order. tf

NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 7-2-15.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

Court ordered no DNA sample and surcharge on this count as it has been ordered on count 2.

Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Christopher A. and Ashley W.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Court ordered 6 month license suspension.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 652
cf
Exhibit List received and filed. tk

The jury returned and by their foreperson returned a verdict as follows:
GUILTY of Attempting to Flee a Traffic Officer
GUILTY of Obstructing an Officer.
Court polls the jury. Court discharged panel. 
Upon motion of the State, Court entered judgemnts of conviction as to Count 1 and Count 2.  No PSI ordered. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriffs Department pending sentencing.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
For reason placed on the record alternate juror selected and released. Jury in the box. Remaining sworn for the State: Jason Daering, Officer for MPD. Sworn for the State: Alan Beattie, Officer- MPD; Geoffrey McClendon, Detective for MPD. Jury out of box. Side bar place on the record. Defense makes motion for dismissal. Arguments heard. Court denies motion. Court advises the defendant on right to testify. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant knowingly and voluntarilywaives right to testify. Jury in the box. State rests. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Court instructs the jury. Closing arguments.  At the hour of 11:42 am, the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Deputy Sheriffs Fox and Tiller who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury out of box.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Recalled case. Same appearance. 
Jury in the box at 1:53 pm. Voire Dior continued. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury out of the box at 3:26 pm. Side bar place on the record. Jury in the box at 3:45 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Jason Daering, Officer- MPD. Exhibits  1, 2, 3 received. Court adjourned jury trial to 05-07-2015 at 8:45 am. Jury out of the box at 4:50 pm.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Parties are prepare to proceed to jury trial. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:37 am.  Jury out of the box at 11:47 am.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions and Motion in Limine received and filed. tk

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  James C. Griffin and Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed by the State:  Witness List, Requested Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5-6-15, 9:00.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Curtis Dwayne Jones in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
